questions.question_text:
An administrator has assigned a global policy package to custom ADOM1. Then the administrator creates a new policy package, Fortinet, in the custom ADOM1.
What happens to the Fortinet policy package when it is created?

choices.B: The global policy package is automatically assigned.
choices.C: You must reapply the global policy package to ADOM1.
choices.D: You can select the option to assign the global policies.
choices.A: You must assign the global policy package from the global ADOM.

questions.question_text: Which output is displayed right after moving the ISFW device from one ADOM to another?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Tested it. Will show "never installed"

Selected Answer: D
Why so many choosing never installed and selected answer as C ? it should be D right ?

Selected Answer: C
It's definitely C. Tested in a lab when migrating a managed device from one ADOM to another and displays 'never-installed'

Selected Answer: C
pkg: never installed

Selected Answer: A
The output that is displayedimmediately after movingthe ISFW device from one ADOM to another isOption A, where the package status is still unknown (pkg: [unknown]) because FortiManager has not yet fully synchronized the device's configuration in the new ADOM.
Answer D

Unknown with policy package name:
Gray question mark
 

Configurations of the managed device are retrieved on FortiManager after being imported/installed.

For example, when you retrieve a policy package after upgrading FortiOS, the policy package status changes to Unknown.

Selected Answer: C
Out of Sync - Policies or objects are modified on the managed device.
Never Installed - The assigned policy package is not the result of an import for this device, and the package has not been installed since it has been assigned to this device.


I think its C

Selected Answer: A
it should be A as the device is not currently linked to any policy package in the new ADOM

comments.content: No the status unknown, just means FMG is unable to determine the pkg status. But here we are talking about after migrating device to another ADOM. the status after migration is "never installed"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer is the third one. 
The policy Package will show never installed, once an import configuration is launched in the new ADOM

choices.A: The administrator must refresh the device to restore connectivity.
choices.C: The administrator can reclaim the FortiGate to FortiManager protocol (FGFM) tunnel to get the device online.
choices.B: FortiManager lost internet connectivity, therefore, the device appears to be down.
choices.D: The administrator recently restored a FortiManager configuration file.
